JobTitle: Internship for Field Biologist - Bayan Lepas
summary:
we are looking for a motivated, dynamic intern for field biologist (fb) to join our team. your responsibilities will be to continuously monitor and ensure service compliance whilst also using your biology / entomology knowledge and outgoing personality to perform on-site inspection at customersâ€™ premise.
to help to achieve this, we will provide you with a competitive allowance and career opportunities. you will also be given full product and solutions training in technical areas, with hands on assistance from our group of specialist and service team.
in this role you will be responsible for:
 constantly monitor and ensure service compliance  undertake quality assurance and field biologist inspections for rentokil reporting services and termite management programs or other high value services sold by the branch  responsible for timely and proper completion of the customers and administrative reports involved in training preparation for pest control division 
requirements:
the ideal candidate will possess:
currently pursuing tertiary education/final semester (bachelor degree in biological science or equivalent, preferably major in entomology or vector control)
possess valid d licence & owns a car  
benefits:
rewards and benefits
 monthly allowance opportunity to be absorbed as permanent employee (based on your work performance) 
you will be welcomed into a friendly, robust and competitive team that are highly motivated and focused on achieving goals and results. you will be given full product training, with hands on assistance from our specialist and service team.
so, what are you waiting for? come, letâ€™s join our team by applying now
equal opportunities 
rentokil initial believes in supporting all employees to provide equal opportunities and avoid discrimination. we also place emphasis on workplace diversity which means that we are serious about creating an inclusive environment that accepts each individual's differences, embraces their strengths and provides opportunities for all colleagues to achieve their full potential.

JobTitle: Internship Project for Process Compass - Quality Department
summary:
company description


bosch has been present in malaysia since 1923, represented by robert bosch sdn bhd. in malaysia, bosch is active in four business sectors: mobility solutions, industrial technology, consumer goods, and energy and building technology. the company has three manufacturing sites and research and development offices in penang, producing automotive electronics, power tools and steering systems, and soon a fourth plant with a final testing centre for sensors and semiconductors. in 2020, bosch malaysia generated consolidated sales of rm 518.4 million (108.1 million euros), and currently employs more than 4,000 associates.
pgp5 plant is bosch groupâ€™s newest expansion in malaysia a semiconductor test site in batu kawan penang. the construction has begun in may 2021 and first series of production to commence in 2023. with the long-term forecasts for growth of semiconductor component quantities, coupled with the front-end production in boschâ€™s dresden facility in germany, capacity expansion is required for the back-end production, which is the final testing phase of semiconductors and sensors. pgp5 will primarily focus on the final testing of components manufactured at bosch automotive electronicsâ€™ fab in dresden, germany. the plant will also house r&d and training facilities.
bosch in malaysia is a part of the bosch group, a leading global supplier of technology and services. the bosch groupâ€™s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life. bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. in short, bosch creates technology that is â€œinvented for lifeâ€.


job description


providing support to all departments regarding the navigation of the process compass setup.
transferring documentation, editing and uploading new document versions, maintaining documentation traceability, overseeing the plant qm website, and handling
other adhoc tasks
candidates with 6 months internship is preferred


qualifications

degree in communication / computer science

additional information


leave entitlement e.g: annual leave, medical leave and etc
company insurances and etc

job responsibilities:

to be responsible for the effective planning, delivery of various computer subjects and academic development of the students as well as to provide pastoral care to students.
to develop and manage learning modules and to ensure that academic programmes are delivered in accordance with the prescribed quality standards.
to assess and evaluate studentsâ€™ performance to ensure that learning objectives have been achieved through summative and formative assessment.
to participate in extra curricular activities or other functions as and when required.

job requirements:

minimum of an undergraduate degree in information technology, computer science, software engineering, or a related field with at least a minimum of 5 years of strong industry experience in software development, system design, or related roles is highly desirable.
preferably with a masterâ€™s degree or ph.d in it/ computer science or equivalent.
experience in teaching computer science or software engineering courses at the undergraduate or postgraduate level is an added advantage
have a strong understanding of data structures, data modelling and software architecture.
candidates must be able to teach technical modules with proficiency in relational database structures, research methods, machine learning, cloud based technologies, iot, scripting languages (i.e. python, perl), programing languages (i.e. java, c/c++, php, .net, sql).
have experience in big data technologies (i.e. hadoop, hbase, lucene/solr), analytics packages (i.e. r, mahout, matlab, octave, weka) is an added advantage.
possess good communication, interpersonal and presentation skills in both english & bahasa malaysia.

we thank applicants for their interest, but only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

JobTitle: Intern/Industrial Trainee for Cancer Research Malaysia
summary:
our internship programme is a great way for undergraduate and graduate students to gain a unique insight into the cancer research and charity sector. throughout the 10-week duration (exceptions apply) of the internship, students will have the opportunity to:

enhance their scientific knowledge
gain professional experience
obtain hands-on research experience
interact with faculty, postdoctoral fellows, and graduate students
attend group meeting sessions to learn about in-progress projects
present their research at a special session at the end of the training

you may choose three (3) of the research unit below for application purpose:
a)Â cancer prevention & population science
conducts research in the asian population to determine a personâ€™s risk of cancer and to find ways to reduce the risk. we now know that both inherited genetic factors and lifetime exposure to risk factors (such as tobacco, alcohol, diet, obesity and exercise, our microbiome, our hormones, environmental pollutants and infections) combine to put a person at risk of cancer. we aim to develop a better understanding of these genetic, lifestyle and environmental risk factors in the asian population and to develop interventions to enable prevention and early detection of cancer.
b)Â genomics & bioinformatics
develops comprehensive molecular genetic analyses of cancers common in asia.Â our primary goal is to identify the population-specific molecular, genetic, immunological and micro-environmental features in cancers in asian populations, using new sequencing technologies and histopathological knowledge.Â armed with this knowledge, we aim to discover new therapeutic and diagnostic targets and biomarkers, and to evaluate and uncover known and unknown carcinogens by mutational signature analyses for cancer prevention.
c) translational cancer biology
investigates the critical genetic, molecular and cellular changes underlying cancer development, focusing on cancers that disproportionately affect asians [such as oral and nasopharyngeal cancers]. as de novo drug development is a lengthy and costlyÂ process, we aim to identify drugs that have been developed for other diseases or other types of cancers which have the potential to be repurposed for headÂ and neck cancers. using cancer genomics, cell biology and cancer drug response, we aim to identify new therapeutic approaches to oral and nasopharyngeal cancer.Â 
d) cancer immunology and immunotherapy
developsÂ systemic immunotherapeutic approaches to improve patient outcome. our goal is to identify ways by which the immune system can be modulated for cancer treatment and develop effective immunotherapy for cancers especially cancers that are common in the asian region.
e) clinical trials
translates internal scientific discoveries to the clinic through clinical trials to enable personalized cancer treatment and early adoption of innovative therapies in malaysia. our focus is initiating investigational oncology studies with clinical and biological endpoints, in partnership with clinicians, research institutions, hospitals and commercial sponsors like pharmaceutical companies.Â 
f) core laboratory
brings togetherÂ skills in biospecimen collections and genetic technologies to provide the platform for translational cancer research and adoption of precision medicine in malaysia.
g) genetic counselling
conducts research in methods to improveÂ access to genetic counselling and testing to the population. we examine the communication and psychosocial needs of the diverse asian communities in malaysia, focusing on the needs ofÂ patients and their family members in relation to genetic testing for hereditary cancers.Â 
h) community outreach
collaboratively develops intervention programmes to promote early detection and improve accessÂ to breast cancer care for women seeking treatment at ministry of health hospitals.
i) digital health
develops andÂ evaluatesÂ innovative strategies that facilitates the early detection of cancer, focusing on cancers common in the asian population.Â digital health includes mobile health, wearable devices, telehealth and telemedicine.Â these technologies can empower consumers to make better informed decisions about their own health, and provide new options for facilitating prevention, early diagnosis and management of cancer outside of traditional care settings.
applications are reviewed four (4) times a year. successful candidates will be notified within one (1) month from the date of the application submission deadline.

do i need to meet all the requirements to apply? no. studies by several different sources have shown that, on average, men will apply for a job if they meet 60% of the requirements. in contrast, women, non-binary, and neurodivergent people aim for closer to 90%! please donâ€™t let us miss out on everything you have to offer just because there is some upskilling to do. we can teach the specifics of the job. what we canâ€™t teach is character â€“ ie confidence, capability, curiosity as a valued member of â€˜logicalis asia pacificâ€™ you will enjoy several benefits, such as:  supportive team environment: confidential pulse checks tell us we are known for being 'unselfish with knowledge', 'flexible and diverse' and 'give a shout-out and there will always be help.' pick your own adventure: our people have moved from helpdesk to cloud-engineering. admin to project/program management. project management to product development. if something interests you, weâ€™ll fund you to learn it, so you can become it! breadth of experience and purpose: people here can have an idea, make a plan, and see it through. our people enjoy genuinely impacting change and controlling their professional success. flexible, modern, working arrangements: find your own method for collaboration and productivity to achieve a happy balance. #li-onsite   about logicalis asia pacific msc sdn bhd

intern will work closely with our health, safety, security and environment team to support various initiatives aimed at ensuring a safe and environmentally responsible workplace. this internship offers an excellent opportunity for individuals pursuing a career in hsse to gain hands-on experience and contribute to meaningful projects.




assist in conducting risk assessments and inspections to identify potential hazards in the workplace.
support the development and implementation of safety policies, procedures, and training programs.
participate in incident investigations, including data collection and analysis.
assist in maintaining hsse documentation, records, and reports.
help coordinate security and safety meetings and training sessions.
support environmental initiatives, such as waste management and sustainability projects.
assist in conducting audits to ensure compliance with hsse regulations and standards.
collaborate with cross-functional teams to promote a culture of safety and environmental stewardship.
stay updated on relevant hsse regulations and best practices.
undertake any other tasks or projects related to hsse as assigned.
 Â 




strong interest in pursuing a career in hsse.
excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
detail-oriented with strong organizational skills.
proficiency in microsoft office suite.
prior internship or work experience in hse is a plus but not required.
knowledge of hse regulations and standards is desirable.
willingness to learn and take on new challenges.
 Â 




degree in occupational health and safety & environmental, or a related field.

JobTitle: Internship in Sourcing for Indirect Procurement
summary:
company description

at bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich peopleâ€™s lives. our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. join in and feel the difference.

job description


assist in daily functioning of the indirect sourcing team.
support all 6 categories including logistics, machinery & mro, facility & professional services.
assist in running reports and tracking key performance indicators for the group.
coordinate and follow-up on assigned tasks.
participate in external and internal negotiations along with category experts.
coordinate with associates from the plant to implement projects to generate savings.


qualifications


bachelor degree in engineering or supply chain.
knowledgeable in microsoft excel, power point, word and power bi


additional information

local student needing to complete internship as part of their tertiary education.

as an intern, you will be reporting to the technical support manager, lead support specialist or the associate district manager. you will learn and understand from the technical and service associates the analysis of pest data such as pest type, pest count, various monitoring devices and equipment, service procedures and quality audits, service schedule & routing, customer service & relationship and management skills.you will also learn how to analyze pest risk towards public & environmental and human health, pest hazards, root cause analysis & problem resolution in different industries and customer sites. during this process, you will learn about the integrated pest management (ipm) philosophy and application in urban pest management.in terms of individual leadership development, you will learn about the organization management structure, people management skills, team development and enhancement by organizing, hosting, leading meetings or appointments, and deliver the desired results. you will also go through coaching, guiding, mentoring, training program planning and implementation.furthermore, as part of digital business transformation, you will understand how digital business solutions will be applied in pest management industry. you will also be given the opportunity to summarize your learnings in business reviews, technical and operational reviews, as well to service level improvement plans.
our commitment to diversity and inclusion
ecolab is committed to fair and equal treatment of associates and applicants and furthering the principles of equal opportunity to employment. our goal is to fully utilize minority, female, and disabled individuals at all levels of the workforce. we will recruit, hire, promote, transfer and provide opportunities for advancement based on individual qualifications and job performance. in all matters affecting employment, compensation, benefits, working conditions, and opportunities for advancement, ecolab will not discriminate against any associate or applicant for employment because of race, religion, color, creed, national origin,â€¯citizenship status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expressions, geneticâ€¯information, marital status, age, or disability.

are you a creative and talented individual with a passion for digital design? are you looking for an opportunity to showcase your skills and gain valuable experience in a professional setting? if so, we have an exciting internship opportunity for a digital designer intern.
responsibilities:

collaborate with the design team to create visually appealing and engaging digital assets, including graphics, illustrations, and multimedia content.
assist in the development and execution of creative concepts for digital campaigns, websites, social media, and other digital platforms.
support the design and layout of web pages, landing pages, and email templates.
ensure brand consistency and adherence to design guidelines in all digital materials.
stay up-to-date with design trends, tools, and industry best practices.
assist with other design-related tasks and projects as assigned.

requirements:

pursuing a degree in graphic design, visual communication, or a related field.
proficient in graphic design software such as adobe photoshop, illustrator, and indesign.
strong sense of creativity and a keen eye for detail.
basic understanding of digital design principles and best practices.
ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
good time management skills and ability to meet deadlines.

why join us:

gain hands-on experience and build your portfolio in digital design.
collaborate with a talented and supportive design team in a professional setting.
opportunity to work on real projects and contribute to creative solutions.
learn from experienced professionals and receive mentorship throughout your internship.
networking opportunities and exposure to various aspects of digital design.

if you are a motivated and passionate digital design enthusiast looking for a valuable learning experience, we want to hear from you. join us as a digital designer intern and unleash your creativity. apply now by submitting your resume and a portfolio jobs@wearepluto.com.my showcasing your design work.
note: this is a paid internship position with the possibility of future employment. only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. we appreciate your interest in pluto communications

at our agency, digital sage, we specialize in a variety of digital marketing services. our offerings include brand design and strategy, social media marketing, performance marketing, search engine optimization, as well as website development and maintenance. we pride ourselves on delivering tailored, data-driven strategies to support sustainable business growth. our team, comprised of experts in various fields, works remotely, ensuring efficient and cost-effective solutions for our clients. we focus on understanding each client's unique needs, providing customized plans to support their specific business goals and industries.
the role
description:
we are seeking a web developer with expertise in cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress to join our team. in this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining websites. your work will involve front-end and back-end development, theme customization, and ensuring the overall performance, security, and user experience of these websites.
responsibilities:

develop and maintain websites on cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress.
design responsive and visually appealing web interfaces.
customize themes to align with client requirements and branding.
create and manage databases, server-side scripts, and apis.
optimize websites for seo and analyze performance metrics.
monitor security, troubleshoot technical issues, and perform updates.
collaborate with clients, offering technical expertise and recommendations.
provide documentation, training, and support to clients and team members.
stay informed about web development trends and industry best practices.
perform any other responsibilities as required to support the needs of the project or the team.

qualifications:

proficiency in cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress development.
strong skills in html, css, javascript, and web technologies.
effective communication and client-facing skills.
problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
familiarity with version control systems is a plus.
understanding of web security principles and best practices.

at our agency, digital sage, we specialize in a variety of digital marketing services. our offerings include brand design and strategy, social media marketing, performance marketing, search engine optimization, as well as website development and maintenance. we pride ourselves on delivering tailored, data-driven strategies to support sustainable business growth. our team, comprised of experts in various fields, works remotely, ensuring efficient and cost-effective solutions for our clients. we focus on understanding each client's unique needs, providing customized plans to support their specific business goals and industries.
the role
description:
we are seeking a web developer with expertise in cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress to join our team. in this role, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining websites. your work will involve front-end and back-end development, theme customization, and ensuring the overall performance, security, and user experience of these websites.
responsibilities:

develop and maintain websites on cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress.
design responsive and visually appealing web interfaces.
customize themes to align with client requirements and branding.
create and manage databases, server-side scripts, and apis.
optimize websites for seo and analyze performance metrics.
monitor security, troubleshoot technical issues, and perform updates.
collaborate with clients, offering technical expertise and recommendations.
provide documentation, training, and support to clients and team members.
stay informed about web development trends and industry best practices.
perform any other responsibilities as required to support the needs of the project or the team.

qualifications:

proficiency in cs-cart, shopify, and wordpress development.
strong skills in html, css, javascript, and web technologies.
effective communication and client-facing skills.
problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
familiarity with version control systems is a plus.
understanding of web security principles and best practices.
adaptability and a willingness to learn and work with new technologies.
